info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 24 at 3:29PM CDT until June 26 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM CDT FOR SHERIDAN...EAST CENTRAL MCLEAN AND NORTH CENTRAL BURLEIGH COUNTIES... At 328 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mcclusky, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters at 325 PM CDT reported quarter size hail 5 miles southeast of McClusky. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Mcclusky, Goodrich, Mercer, Denhoff, Hoffer Lake and New Johns Lake. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
